page.title: 12East Brent Harvest Home
page.content: Every year at the end of August the Harest Home is held in the village. It is an important event which first started in 1857.It was suggested by a church warden John Higgs to the vicar of that time, Arch Deacon Dennison. It was held to thank God for the harvest and for his goodness.It was also a holiday for the farm workers and was probably the only day off they had in the year.The first Harvest Home was held in the grounds of the vicarage - now Rossholme School, using a large marquee. The Harvest Home held every year until 1914, it stopped then because of the war and did not start again until 1957.
